Study: Respiratory surveillance wards as a strategy to reduce nosocomial transmission of COVID-19 through early detection: the experience of a tertiary hospital in Singapore.
Proposed Solution: Institution introduced a "respiratory surveillance ward" (RSW) to segregate all patients with respiratory symptoms in designated areas

Study: Repurposing and reshaping of hospitals during the COVID-19 outbreak in South Korea.
Challenge: Mitigate community transmission and prevent nosocomial infection.
Proposed Solution: The reallocation of health care capacity, repurposing of hospitals, and close collaboration between the government and the health care committee might have been the key to successfully addressing the crisis of COVID-19 given the shortage of health care resources.

Study: COVID-19, superinfections and antimicrobial development: What can we expect?
Challenge: Superinfections, AMR and antimicrobial development during the pandemic
Proposed Solution: Results from carefully designed studies early in the pandemic can be used to inform rational antimicrobial treatment and stewardship strategies, and to develop diagnostic criteria for superinfections.

Study: Environmental Contamination of SARS-CoV-2 in Healthcare Premises.
Challenge: Hospitals are significant epicenters for the human-to-human transmission
Proposed Solution: Ensure adequate environmental cleaning, strengthen infection prevention training, and improve infection prevention among HCWs during the outbreak of COVID-19.

Study: Rapid Implementation of an Adult COVID-19 Unit in a Children's Hospital.
Challenge: Rapid implementation of an adult unit
Proposed Solution: Pediatric team screened, admitted, and cared for hospitalized adults by leveraging the familiarity of our system, adaptability of our staff, and high-quality infrastructure.

Study: A quick evaluation method of nosocomial infection risk for cancer hospitals during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Journal: Journal of Cancer Research and Clinical Oncology
Proposed Solution: Develop a risk model based on the experience of recently resumed activities in many cancer hospitals in China, could also be integrated into the hospital's emergency response system in a timely manner.

Study: COVID-19 and its implications in the management of resource infrastructure.
Proposed Solution: Keeping stock of equipment and of planning longer and more frequent shifts

Study: Prevention of nosocomial COVID-19: Another challenge of the pandemic.
Proposed Solution: Optimal preventive approach, which will probably include the regular screening of all asymptomatic healthcare personnel working at wards with high rates of nosocomial transmission.

Study: Implementing Physical Distancing in the Hospital: A Key Strategy to Prevent Nosocomial Transmission of COVID-19
Proposed Solution: Physical distancing in the hospital is critical to ensure the health and well-being of the health professional workforce during the pandemic.

Study: COVID-19: Limiting the Risks for Eye Care Professionals.
Challenge: Limiting the Risks for Eye Care Professionals
Proposed Solution: Strategies and recommendations for ophthalmologists to reduce transmission: Minimizing Exposures, Standard and Transmission-Directed Precautions, Aerosol-Generating and Contact or Invasive Diagnostic Procedures, Non-Emergency Surgery, Infection Control at the Hospital. Association between conjunctivitis and SARS-CoV-2 is still unclear.

Study: Surgical Infection Society Guidance for Operative and Peri-Operative Care of Adult Patients Infected by the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2)
Proposed Solution: Patient Environment, Peri-Operative Considerations for COVID-19 Patients, Removal of Surgical Attire after the Operation,  High-Risk Interventions and COVID-19 Patients (ET intubation, Tracheostomy, Endoscopy, Laparoscopy, Surgical smoke evacuation), Cleaning the OR, Potential Exposure of a Provider

Study: The prevention and management of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak in radiology departments in epidemic areas.
Adressed Population: prevention and management of COVID-19 outbreak in radiology departments
Proposed Solution: Lays out the plan for disease prevention and control in the radiology department of our hospital to provide a reference for hospital managers and our peers in radiology departments around the world.

Study: Can N95 respirators be reused after disinfection? And for how many times?
Proposed Solution: Heating (dry or in the presence humidity) <100 °C can preserve the filtration characteristics of a pristine N95 respirator, but advise against using certain liquid contact, such as alcohol solutions, chlorine-based solutions, or soaps to clean the respirator, as this will lead to a degradation.

Study: European Society of Trauma and Emergency Surgery (ESTES) recommendations for trauma and emergency surgery preparation during times of COVID-19 infection.
Journal: European Society of Trauma and Emergency Surgery
Proposed Solution: (1) General recommendation for surgical services; (2) Emergency Surgery for critically ill COVID-19 positive or suspected patients -Preoperative planning and case selection; (3) Operating Room setup; (4) patient transport to the OR; (5) Surgical staf preparation; (6) Anesthesia considerations; (7) Surgical approach; and (8) Case Completion.

Study: Nosocomial infections in psychiatric hospitals during the new coronavirus pneumonia (NCP) outbreak.
Proposed Solution: 10 recommendations for prevention: including early discharging and often patient/staff temp checks

Study: Aerosol and Surface Stability of SARS-CoV-2 as Compared with SARS-CoV-1.
Proposed Solution: Results indicate that aerosol and fomite transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is plausible, forms of transmission which were associated with nosocomial spread and super-spreading events

Study: How to avoid nosocomial spread during Tracheostomy for Covid-19 patients.
Journal: Journal of Sciences and Specialties of the Head and Neck
Proposed Solution: Modified tracheostomy procedure instruction

Study: How to transform a general hospital into an “infectious disease hospital” during the epidemic of COVID-19
Challenge: General hospital into an “infectious disease hospital”
Proposed Solution: Reconstructing an existing hospital into an infectious disease hospital (IDH) is an important strategy to prepare for the epidemic

Study: Nosocomial infection among patients with coronavirus disease-2019: a retrospective data analysis of 918 cases from a single center in Wuhan city, China.
Proposed Solution: Nosocomial infections are common among patients with COVID19 and can be predictable by considering certain risk factors: diabetes, hematological disease, invasive devices (CVC or PICC), combination of antibiotics, and glucocorticoid treatment.

Study: Donor organ evaluation in the era of coronavirus disease 2019: A case of nosocomial infection
Journal: The Journal of Heart and Lung Transplantation
Proposed Solution: The International Society for Heart and Lung Transplantation currently recommends that all donors should be tested for SARS-CoV-2 infection if testing is available. Decline organs from donors with positive RT-PCR testing, even for an isolated cardiac transplant

Study: The efficiency in the ordinary hospital bed management in Italy: an in-depth analysis of intensive care unit in the areas affected by COVID-19 before the outbreak
Proposed Solution: Study underlines that, despite the reduction of beds for the majority of the hospital wards, ICUs availabilities did not change, allowing hospitals to treat patients without the risk of having an overabundance of patients and a scarcity of beds.

Study: Assessment of preparedness against emerging infectious disease among private hospitals in a district of South India
Challenge: Enhance the preparedness of the hospitals in the response against emerging infectious diseases
Proposed Solution: There were gaps in the implementation of various plans and protocols for staff training, risk communication, surge capacity, laboratory capacity, and infection control in the hospitals.

Study: Application of refined management in prevention and control of the coronavirus disease 2019 epidemic in non-isolated areas of a general hospital
Proposed Solution: The accuracy rate of mask-wearing and hand hygiene compliance of patients and their families need to be further improved.

Study: Guidelines for dental care provision during the COVID-19 pandemic
Proposed Solution: 1. Screening every asymptomatic patient meticulously. 2. Considering every patient as a potential asymptomatic COVID-19 carrier. 3. Considering recently recovered patients as potential virus carriers for at least 30 days after the recovery confirmation by a laboratory test 4. Identifying the urgent need of the patient and focusing on managing it with minimally invasive procedures. 5. Categorising dental treatment according to the urgency of the required treatment and the risk and benefit associated with each treatment. 6. Identifying the required dental treatment for each patient and the risks and benefits associated with that treatment. 7. Using contact, and airborne precautions including proper aerosol-generating procedures personal protective equipment (PPE) for every procedure.

Study: A model to forecast regional demand for COVID-19 related hospital beds
Proposed Solution: An interactive, quantitative model that forecasts demand for COVID-19 related hospitalization based on county-level population characteristics, data from the literature on COVID-19, and data from online repositories will continue to aid community and hospital leaders in their response to COVID-19.

Study: Separate Fever Clinics Prevent the Spread of COVID-19 and Offload Emergency Resources: Analysis from a large tertiary hospital in China
Proposed Solution: The work-load of the Fever Clinic increased after the COVID-19 outbreak and effectively prevented COVID-19 from spreading in the hospital as well as offload ED resources.

Study: Clinical predictors of mortality due to COVID-19 based on an analysis of data of 150 patients from Wuhan, China.
Proposed Solution: Percentage of Nosocomial infection (NI) among COVID-19 patients who died was significantly higher than that of patients who were cured and discharged (p= 0.002)

Study: Risk of nosocomial transmission of coronavirus disease 2019: an experience in a general ward setting in Hong Kong.
Proposed Solution: SARS-CoV-2 is not spread by an airborne route, and nosocomial transmissions can be prevented through vigilant basic infection control measures, including wearing of surgical masks, hand and environmental hygiene.

Study: Hospital pharmacists’ pharmaceutical care for hospitalized patients with COVID-19: Recommendations and guidance from clinical experience
Journal: Research in Social and Administrative Pharmacy
Proposed Solution: Hospital pharmacists shall support pharmaceutical care services by participating in making evidence-based decisions for medication, monitoring and evaluation of medication safety and efficacy, providing strengthened care for special population and patients with combined underlying diseases, monitoring and management of convalescent plasma therapy, providing emotional counselling and psychological support, and providing scientific information about COVID-19 vaccines.

Study: Fangcang shelter hospitals: a novel concept for responding to public health emergencies
Proposed Solution: Fangcang shelter hospitals could be powerful components of national responses to the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as future epidemics and public health emergencies, with their three key characteristics (rapid construction, massive scale, and low cost) and five essential functions (isolation, triage, basic medical care, frequent monitoring and rapid referral, and essential living and social engagement).

Study: Practitioners specialized in oral health and coronavirus disease 2019: Professional guidelines from the French society of stomatology, maxillofacial surgery and oral surgery, to form a common front against the infectious risk.
Journal: The French Society of Stomatology, Maxillo-Facial Surgery and Oral Surgery (SFSCMFCO)
Proposed Solution: (1) General guidelines and recommendations for practitioners specialized in oral health including regarding safety glasses, masks, gloves, hand washing, disposable items, cleaning protocols; (2) management of an asymptomatic patient or with few symptoms carrying the Covid-19 including transfer, OR, inpatient; (3) management of patients with Covid-19, hospitalized because of their own pathology in adult medical or surgical intensive care units including delayed treatment, transfer, telemedicine, OR.

Study: Radiotherapy Workflow and Protection Procedures During the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Outbreak: Experience of the Hubei Cancer Hospital in Wuhan, China
Challenge: patient and staff COVID-19 protection and prevention
Proposed Solution: Hospital and radiotherapy center implemented multiple measures for patient and staff COVID-19 protection and prevention and during the 6+ weeks of radiation oncology clinical operation, no COVID-19 infection occurred at our radiotherapy center for our patients or employees.

Study: Maximizing the Calm before the Storm: Tiered Surgical Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Proposed Solution: A tiered plan for surgical department planning based on incident command levels. This includes Acute Care Surgeon deployment (given their critical care training and vertically integrated position in the hospital), recommended infrastructure and transfer utilization, triage principles, and faculty, resident and advanced care practitioner deployment.

Study: RESOURCES FOR SMOKE & GAS EVACUATION DURING OPEN, LAPAROSCOPIC, AND ENDOSCOPIC PROCEDURES
Journal: Society of American Gastrointestinal and Endoscopic Surgeons (SAGES)
Proposed Solution: Use of filtration during laproscopy, smoke and gas evacuation methods and products

Study: Screening and managing of suspected or confirmed novel coronavirus (COVID-19) patients: experiences from a tertiary hospital outside Hubei province
Challenge: Screening and managing of suspected or confirmed novel coronavirus
Proposed Solution: Whilst screening out-patients presenting to a fever clinic remains important, monitoring visitors must not be overlooked.

Study: COVID-19: Forecasting short term hospital needs in France
Proposed Solution: While drastic social distancing measures may temper our results, a massive reorganization leading to an expansion of French ICU capacities seems to be necessary to manage the coming wave of critically affected COVID-19 patients.

Study: COVID-19 outbreak: less stethoscope, more ultrasound
Proposed Solution: Suggest promotion of lung ultrasound during consultation to reduce nosocomial outbreaks

Study: The prevention of nosocomial SARS-CoV2 transmission in endoscopy: a systematic review of recommendations within gastroenterology to identify best practice.
Proposed Solution: Only 32% (9/28) of all gastroenterology and endoscopy societies issued guidance on endoscopy in the COVID-19 pandemic-->therefore, stronger evidence to inform current practice and robust guidelines are urgently needed to prevent the transmission of SARS-CoV2 in gastrointestinal endoscopy departments worldwide.

Study: A high efficient hospital emergency responsive mode is the key of successful treatment of 100 COVID-19 patients in Zhuhai
Challenge: Management and treatment of COVID-19 patients
Proposed Solution: Establishment of Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia department, which is administratively led by the president of hospital directly and specialized conduct by respiratory professor, is the key to success in management and treatment of COVID-19 patients. This hospital emergency responsive mode could provide reference for other hospitals and cities in epidemic situation.

Study: COVID-19: Recommendations for Management of Elective Surgical Procedures
Proposed Solution: Elective/Inpatient Facilities can be delayed

Study: Guidance for health system contingency planning during widespread transmission of SARS-CoV-2 with high impact on healthcare services
Journal: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
Proposed Solution: (1) Contingency planning within the primary care setting; (2) Contingency planning within the hospital setting; (2a) Outpatient facilities; (2b) Inpatient facilities; (2c) Long-term care facilities

Study: Hospital biopreparedness in the Looming Presence of SARS‐CoV‐2/COVID‐19
Proposed Solution: Employment of the i3 strategy (identify, isolate, and inform) and those foundational infection prevention practices are necessary to help avoid additional cases of COVID‐19, in addition to other infectious diseases.

Study: Emergency management for preventing and controlling nosocomial infection of the 2019 novel coronavirus: implications for the dermatology department.
Proposed Solution: Telemedicine/online in dermatology to reduce patient-physician interaction time

Study: Protecting Chinese Healthcare Workers While Combating the 2019 Novel Coronavirus
Proposed Solution: More PPE should be produced or imported,and delivered to hospitals quickly. Training of HCWs to identify suspicious cases and use PPE properly is in urgent need, especially for HCWs in departments other than infectious diseases. Concealing medical history should have legal consequences.

Study: Air, Surface Environmental, and Personal Protective Equipment Contamination by Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) From a Symptomatic Patient
Journal: Journal of the American Medical Association
Challenge: Significant environmental contamination by patients with SARS-CoV-2
Proposed Solution: Significant environmental contamination by patients with SARS-CoV-2 through respiratory droplets and fecal shedding suggests the environment as a potential medium of transmission and supports the need for strict adherence to environmental and hand hygiene.

Study: Practical experiences and suggestions for the ‘eagle-eyed observer’: a novel promising role for controlling nosocomial infection in the COVID-19 outbreak
Proposed Solution: Eagle-eyed observer system may help to control nosocomial infection with COVID-19 and other acute infectious diseases.

Study: Clinical Data on Hospital Environmental Hygiene Monitoring and Medical Staff Protection during the Coronavirus Disease 2019 Outbreak
Proposed Solution: Viruses could be detected on the surfaces of the nurse station in the isolation area with suspected patients and in the air of the isolation ward with an intensive care patient. Ensure the safety of medical treatment and the quality of hospital infection control through the monitoring of environmental hygiene.

Study: Healthcare Facilities: Preparing for Community Transmission / Interim Guidance for Healthcare Facilities: Preparing for Community Transmission of COVID-19 in the United States
Journal: Center for Disease Control and Prevention
Proposed Solution: (1) Actions to take now to prepare for an outbreak of COVID-19; (2) Plan to Take the Following Actions if COVID-19 is spreading in your community; (3) Considerations for specific settings: (3a) Outpatient facilities; (3b) Inpatient facilities; (3c) Long-term care facilities

Study: Minimise nosocomial spread of 2019-nCoV when treating acute respiratory failure
Proposed Solution: We recommend the adoption of helmets and avoidance of face masks as the non-invasive ventilation interface, and suggest that manufacturers should develop cheap and safe non-invasive ventilation interfaces to be used during viral pandemics.

Study: Integrated infection control strategy to minimize nosocomial infection of coronavirus disease 2019 among ENT healthcare workers.
Proposed Solution: Decrease patient density, protectice measures during examination, and pre-appointment temperature monitoring

Study: Transmission Potential of SARS-CoV-2 in Viral Shedding Observed at the University of Nebraska Medical Center
Proposed Solution: SARS-CoV-2 is shed during respiration, toileting, and fomite contact, indicating that infection may occur in both direct and indirect contact. Maintain airborne isolation standards including respiratory protection and include routine systematic environmental cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas and surrounding environments.

Study: Staff safety during emergency airway management for COVID-19 in Hong Kong
Proposed Solution: Safety during patient intubation and ventilation

Study: Reply to “Coronavirus 2019-nCoV: A brief perspective from the front line”: Nosocomial SARS-CoV-2 infection among nurses in Wuhan from a single center
Proposed Solution: Medical waste protocols, nursing flow -- work hours, dining times

Study: Protecting health-care workers from subclinical coronavirus infection
Proposed Solution: Use of PPE during asymptomatic spread

Study: Clinical Characteristics of 138 Hospitalized Patients With 2019 Novel Coronavirus-Infected Pneumonia in Wuhan, China.
Journal: Journal of the American Medical Association
Proposed Solution: Presumed human-to-human hospital-associated transmission of 2019-nCoV was suspected in 41% of patients.
